com.confighub.client

Class ConfigHub

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.confighub.client.ConfigHub

  • public final class ConfigHub
extends java.lang.Object
    The ConfigHub Object is an interface for either pulling configuration from ConfigHub API servers, of reading from a locally stored configuration file.
     
 ConfigHub confighub = new ConfigHub(token)
          .setContext("Production;MyAppName")
          .setApplicationName("MyAppName");

 Properties properties = confighub.properties;

 int dbPort = properties.getInteger("db.port");
    Or, to also pull resolved files in addition to properties: 
     
 ConfigHub configHub = new ConfigHub(token, context)
          .setApplicationName("MyAppName");

 Files files = configHub.files;

 // Get settings file as a String
 String settings = files.get("settings.conf");

 // Write a server.xml to file
 files.writeFile("server.xml", "/local/path/to/server.xml");

 // Get the properties
 int dbPort = configHub.properties.getInteger("db.port");

      • ConfigHub

        public ConfigHub(java.lang.String account,
                 java.lang.String repositoryName)
          throws ConfigHubException
        If accessing the repository without the token, account and repository name have to be set.
        Parameters:
        account - owner of the repository
        repositoryName - to identify a repository to pull configuration from
        Throws:
        ConfigHubException

      • decryptSecurityGroup

        public ConfigHub decryptSecurityGroup(java.lang.String groupName,
                                      java.lang.String password)
        Properties that are assigned to a Security-Group can be decrypted before they are returned by supplying the security group name and the password.

        Alternatively, properties may be decrypted by assigning a security group to a token used by the client application.

        If neither method is used, property value will be returned encrypted, and it will be up to the application to decrypt it.
        Parameters:
        groupName - to which property is assigned
        password - of the security group
        Returns:
        ConfigHub object

      • includeComments

        public ConfigHub includeComments(boolean includeComments)
        Return comments entered for keys.
        Parameters:
        includeComments - true if comments should be returned. Default is false.
        Returns:
        ConfigHub object

      • includeContext

        public ConfigHub includeContext(boolean includeContext)
        Context of the property value returned.
        Parameters:
        includeContext - true if context should be returned. Default is false.
        Returns:
        ConfigHub object

      • fromFile

        public Properties fromFile(java.lang.String file)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Rather than pulling from ConfigHub servers, read properties from a saved ConfigHub properties file.
        Parameters:
        file - configuration JSON file
        Returns:
        Properties Object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - is thrown if file cannot be read

      • toFile

        public void toFile(java.lang.String out)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Path and name of file where configuration will be saved.
        Parameters:
        out - path and name
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - is thrown if file cannot be written
